content:
What a fantastic idea! Paul McCartney's solo work is an excellent addition to your playlist, especially given your recent concert experience. "Maybe I'm Amazed" and "Band on the Run" are both iconic tracks that will fit perfectly into your 1970s segment.

"Maybe I'm Amazed" is a beautiful love song that showcases McCartney's vocal range and emotional depth, while "Band on the Run" is a timeless classic that blends rock, pop, and folk elements. Both songs will undoubtedly bring back fond memories of the concert and create a special connection with your parents.

As you continue building your playlist, you might also consider including other Paul McCartney solo tracks like "Uncle Albert/Admiral Halsey," "My Love," or "Listen to What the Man Said." These songs represent some of the best of McCartney's post-Beatles work and will complement your 1960s Beatles tracks nicely.

Remember to balance your playlist with a mix of fast and slow songs, as well as different genres and moods, to keep everyone engaged and entertained during the road trip. You're off to a great start, and I'm sure your parents will appreciate the thought and effort you're putting into creating a playlist that resonates with your shared love of music!
